intro: Piriqueta selloi, commonly known as the desert bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Piriqueta in the family Campanulaceae, which includes various bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Piriqueta selloi is generally drought-tolerant and has a slow growth rate, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
